channel.title: RSCD NPC.java Points to Stats
channel.description:
Hello bengina and the others which working on a points based server.. i made a 2 string..
its for: Attack, Strength, Defense, Prayer, Ranged and Magic!
file: [url=http://www.speedyshare.com/files/19861177/Statguy.rar]http://www.speedyshare.com/files/19861177/Statguy.rar[/url]
no errors, and my point system is added getPoints() threw db, not added like a skill (Cooking). ~Crooks And Merry Christmas :)

item.title: RSCD NPC.java Points to Stats
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

The second code which has been cleared up compiles fine and you can talk to the npc but doesnt send the string options, C R O O K S version works perfectly.
If you are using easyrsc you need to add a boolean to both files as they are int,int,boolean and you need int,int,boolean,boolean or you will get errors, also take a look at owner.checkEquipment(); as if you dont have it defined in player.java that will also cause an error or just remove it as its not really needed.

Thanks again to both for helping

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD NPC.java Points to Stats
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

I looked at this and cried…

So I decided to make this bring less tears to my eyes…

[code]package org.rscdaemon.server.npchandler;

import org.rscdaemon.server.model.Player;
import org.rscdaemon.server.model.Npc;
import org.rscdaemon.server.model.World;
import org.rscdaemon.server.model.InvItem;
import org.rscdaemon.server.model.ChatMessage;
import org.rscdaemon.server.model.MenuHandler;
import org.rscdaemon.server.event.ShortEvent;
import org.rscdaemon.server.util.DataConversions;

public class Statguy implements NpcHandler {
/**
* World instance
*/
public static final World world = World.getWorld();
public void handleNpc(final Npc npc, final Player player) throws Exception {
player.informOfNpcMessage(new ChatMessage(npc, “Good Day, i can trade in your points for stats”, player));
player.setBusy(true);
world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new ShortEvent(player) {
public void action() {
owner.setBusy(false);
final String[] options = { “Attack”, “Defense”, “Strength”, “Ranged”, “Prayer”, “Magic” };
final int[] ptsReq = { 100, 500, 1000, 2500, 5000, 10000, 20000, 40000, 100000 };
final int[] expGained = { 2000, 10000, 20000, 50000, 100000, 200000, 400000, 800000, 2000000 };
final String[] options2 = new String[]{“2k = 100pts”, “10k = 500pts”, “20k = 1000 pts”, “50k = 2500pts”, “100k = 5000pts”, “200k = 10000 pts”, “400k = 20000 pts”, “800k = 40000pts”, “2mil = 100k pts”, " Take Pts Back"};
owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("@lre@You can also take back points from a skill.");
owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(options) {
public void handleReply(final int option, final String reply) {
if(owner.isBusy()) {
return;
}

					owner.setBusy(true);
					world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new ShortEvent(owner) {
						public void action() {
							owner.setBusy(false);
							owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(options2) {
								public void handleReply(final int option1, final String reply) {
									if(owner.isBusy())
										return;

									owner.setBusy(true);
									world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new ShortEvent(owner) {
										public void action() {
											owner.setBusy(false);
											owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(options2) {
												public void handleReply(final int option1, final String reply) {
													if(owner.isBusy())
														return;

													owner.setBusy(true);
													world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new ShortEvent(owner) {
														public void action() {
															owner.setBusy(false);
															if(option1 < 9) {
																if(owner.getPoints() >= ptsReq[option1]) {
																	if (player.getMaxStat(option) >= 99)
																	{ player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You cannot add anymore points to this skill");
																	return;
																	}
																	owner.setPoints(owner.getPoints() - ptsReq[option1]);
																	owner.getActionSender().sendPoints();
																	owner.incExp(option, expGained[option1], true);
																	if(option < 2) {
																		owner.getActionSender().sendStat(option);
																		owner.incExp(3, expGained[option1] / 3, true);
																		owner.getActionSender().sendStat(3);
																	}
																} else {
																	owner.informOfNpcMessage(new ChatMessage(npc, "Go fuck yourself", owner));
																}
																npc.unblock();
																player.setBusy(false);
															} else {
																int Points = 0;
																if(owner.getMaxStat(option) > 5) {
																	Points = DataConversions.roundUp(owner.getPoints() + owner.getExp(option) / 20);
																	owner.setPoints(Points);
																	if(option < 2)
																		owner.incExp(3, -owner.getExp(option) / 3, true);
																	owner.incExp(option, -owner.getExp(option), true);
																	owner.incCurStat(option, -owner.getCurStat(option) + 1);
																	owner.getActionSender().sendStats();
																	owner.getActionSender().sendPoints();
																	owner.checkEquipment();
																}
																npc.unblock();
																player.setBusy(false);
																break;
															}
															owner.getActionSender().sendMenu(options2);
															npc.unblock();
															player.setBusy(false);
														}
													});
												}
											}
										}
									});
								}
							});
							owner.getActionSender().sendMenu(options);
						}
					});
					npc.blockedBy(player);
				}
			}
		}
	});
}

}[/code]

All I did was change the need for all the repetitive code, I never attempted compiling what was initially posted, so I can’t say whether this will compile, or even work, seeing I was just going off of what was provided by the poster, and did this in notepad in about 5 mins, lol.

What I can say that it has removed over 1k lines of code, and does the same thing…

Read full topic
